intro: Phormangis schumannii, commonly known as the Schumann's phormangis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and may be used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
